definitions.definition: To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.
definitions.example: He drank the water I gave him.

definitions.definition: (metonymic) To consume the liquid contained within (a bottle, glass, etc.).
definitions.example: Jack drank the whole bottle by himself.
Everyone who is drinking is drinking, but not everyone who is drinking is drinking.

definitions.definition: To take in (a liquid), in any manner; to suck up; to absorb; to imbibe.
To take in; to receive within one, through the senses; to inhale; to hear; to see.
Drinks in general; something to drink

definitions.example: My favourite drink is the White Russian.
Can I buy you a drink?

definitions.definition: The action of drinking, especially with the verbs take or have.
definitions.example: He was about to take a drink from his root beer.
If he doesn't pay off the mafia, he’ll wear cement shoes to the bottom of the drink!

definitions.definition: A short break in play to allow the players to have a drink, and for quick repairs to be made to equipment or the pitch.
